newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: BRITISH LIONS CALL UP NIGEL REDMAN FOR INJURED WEIR.
newsitem.headline: BRITISH LIONS CALL UP NIGEL REDMAN FOR INJURED WEIR.

text.p: England lock Nigel Redman has been called from a tour in Argentina to join the British Lions squad in South Africa to replace Doddie Weir.
Weir damaged knee ligaments in Wednesday's 64-14 win over Mpumalanga province and will return home on Saturday by when the Lions hope to have the Bath lock in their ranks.
"He is a front jumper, a good scrummager with lots of experience and the right kind of character we need out here," said Lions manager Fran Cotton on Thursday.
Redman is the second player to be called from Argentina following the Lions' earlier request for the release of flyhalf Mike Catt who joined the Lions on Wednesday.
England coach Jack Rowell was reported to be unwilling to release Catt but Cotton did not forsee a problem over Redman.
"It would be unprecedented if the request were to be turned down," said Cotton.
Weir was injured when he was kicked on the knee by Mpumalanga lock Marius Bosman.
Cotton said they expected the provincial side to discipline the player and a second lock, Elandre van der Bergh, who was seen stamping on the head of Rob Wainwright.
"We made it absolutely clear to the local union that we expect them to take the appropriate action. If that doesn't happen we will have to consider our position," added Cotton.
Cotton said Mpumalanga should take action within seven days.
